contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Radio station | name = XHAHU | image = | city = [[Anáhuac, Nuevo León]] | area = [[Anáhuac, Nuevo León]]<br>[[Nuevo Laredo|Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas]]<br>[[Laredo, Texas]] | branding = ''Radio Nuevo León'' | slogan = | airdate = | frequency = 103.3 FM | format = Mexican Regional Music | power = 100 kW | erp = | class = C | callsign_meaning = '''XH A'''na'''HU'''ac | former_callsigns = | owner = [[Nuevo León]] State Government | webcast = | website = | affiliations = }} '''XHAHU''' (103.3 [[FM broadcasting|FM]], "Radio Nuevo León") is a [[Mexico|Mexican]] Regional Music format [[radio station]] that serves the [[Anáhuac, Nuevo León]] - [[Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas]], [[Mexico]] and [[Laredo, Texas]], [[United States]] border area. XHAHU is affiliated with the Nuevo León State owned Radio Nuevo León public network.<ref>[http://dgsrt.sct.gob.mx/index.php?id=448 SCT; infraestructura de estaciones de radio y televisión comprende]</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} <br clear=all> {{Nuevo Laredo Radio}} {{coord missing|Mexico}} [[Category:Regional Mexican radio stations]] [[Category:Spanish-language radio stations]] [[Category:Radio stations in Nuevo León]] {{Mexico-radio-station-stub}}
